page.title: 10St Giles Church
page.content: {Mr Walters}has been rector in Stanton for three years. The church was built about 1100 so that makes it about 850 years old. The church gains its name from an ancient baronial family in the North of England,{St. {Quentin,}who at one time occupied the Manor house. Mr Walters enjoys his job although he has many things to do. Stanton church has only got one {stained glass window.}The window shows St Matthew and he has 6 toes on his left foot. Mr Walters said that all stained glass windows tell a story. Stanton church's true name is St Giles church. In 1843 an{organ}was purchased for Â£56.10.0 by public subscription. This was replaced by a new instrument in 1874, built by King of Islington. It cost Â£120, and was placed on the North side of the chancel.
